page.title: 11MOYSES NURSERY / FLOWERS
page.content: Carnations are the dominating plant in many of the glasshouses.Various other plants include : Geraniums,Gazina and Lobelia.The plants are arranged in grids to keep them straight and to provide growing space. The workers use potash (potassium phosphate)and nitrogen as fertilizer. They also use dung. The main disease that threatens Carnations is Potrytis.The other main problems include condensation,which is the cause of Potrytis,and greenfly. The plants in winter need a steady temperature of about 50 degrees c. to survive.In summer the temperature in the glasshouses must be above 100 degrees c.These temperatures are obtained by the opening and closing of air vents which stabilize the temperature.Heat is provided by hot water pipes in the glasshouses.
